Shaking the tree before earnings tomorrow. This stock also stands to gain the most on the Dow30 index if the infrastructure bill goes through on Friday.

"Oct. 13, 2021, The board of directors of Caterpillar Inc. (CAT) voted today to maintain the quarterly dividend of one dollar and eleven cents ($1.11) per share of common stock, payable November 19, 2021, to shareholders of record at the close of business on October 25, 2021." So they are keeping the 8% increase from last quarter.

It's Cat,it rules

(Reuters Oct 28) - Caterpillar Inc reported a quarterly profit on Thursday that beat analysts' estimates.The company's sales have surged for three consecutive quarters as construction demand worldwide has been propped up by an unprecedented level of public spending.Rising oil and commodity prices have also boosted the company's sales, with customers ordering more equipment to ramp up production.Sales from Caterpillar's construction industries business, its largest unit, rose 30%, while sales at its energy & transportation unit jumped 22%.The company's adjusted profit rose to $2.66 per share in the third quarter ended Sept. 30, beating analysts' estimates of $2.20, according to Refinitiv IBES data.Total sales and revenue rose 25.4% to about $12.40 billion, compared with estimates of $12.48 billion.
